headline: Chicken Cacciatore with Rice
description: Quick and easy to make in just one pot, this chicken cacciatore recipe with rice features an aromatic mixture of vegetables and seasonings.
name: Chicken Cacciatore with Rice
recipeIngredient: 1.5 pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into strips

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a pot over medium heat. Add chicken, onion, and garlic; cook until chicken is browned and onion and garlic are softened, 8 to 10 minutes.
Stir in tomatoes, tomato sauce, bell pepper, salt, basil, and cayenne pepper; bring to boil. Cook for 5 minutes.
Stir in rice, cover, and remove from the heat. Let stand until rice is tender, about 5 minutes. Stir before serving.

review.reviewBody: This came out really good. I added some italian seasoning and pepper to help boost the flavor. The instant rice I bought came in 1 cup bags, and the final result was still slightly saucy without being runny; so I would recommend not doing 1.5 cups. You do have to mash up the tomatoes in to smaller chunks while it's cooking so they're not too big. The only other thing I did differently was use red pepper flakes instead of cayenne powder, but I think they are the same thing just in different forms. You can buy brown instant rice to make the recipe slightly healthier but it's not a particularly unhealthy recipe anyways!

I made a couple of changes, added mushrooms to the garlic and onion before the chicken and used long cook rice, cooked about 20 minutes stir a lot to keep rice from sticking. It was great everybody loved it. Was very easy to make.

It was good and very easy to make. I added some italian spices to it as well. I would probably add more spice and more sauce next time because it was a little dry for our liking, but overall, pretty good! I will make it again.
I left my husband to try this recipe for the first time. He followed the recipe exactly. It was delicious, we will definitely make again

Great recipe! I added oregano, celery seed and fennel seed in addition to what the recipe called for. And I used regular rice and it cooked up fine; I boiled it for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Yummy!

This turned out really good! And came together fairly quickly. Easily doable as a weeknight dish. I used 1.5 tsp salt, which to me was the perfect amount. I used barley in place of rice as it is better for your heart and blood sugar. Next time I will double the basil and cayenne, and add 1 tsp oregano also. I broke up the tomatoes with my wooden spatula as everything was cooking, so next time I may just buy sliced stewed tomatoes instead of whole to save myself that step. Will be making again!
Super easy and relatively quick. My husband said “I can tell by just looking at it I’m going to want you to make this again.” I put more cayenne pepper in for a spicy dish.
This is so simple and delicious. I like it better than traditional cacciatore. I like the breasts sliced instead of whole.
not yet. I was wondering if you can use already cooked rice and if so how much. I don't buy minute or instant rice.
I thought this was good but it needs more seasoning. Next time I will add fresh basil for added flavor.

What an easy and delicious recipe! 5 stars for simplicity alone! I actually used some leftover brown rice in place of the insta-rice to make it even easier (just threw the already-cooked brown rice in at the end to heat up, and let it sit for 5 minutes like the recipe says). I liked the flavor too--pretty straightforward, but good. I could see adding a bit of wine to deglaze the pan after cooking the chicken, onion, and garlic for a touch more flavor if you felt so inclined (I will do this next time--and there will be a next time for this recipe!!). I might add some oregano too. Also, I simply salted to taste for this recipe, and I think we used approx 1 tsp. 2 tsps would have been too salty for our tastes--so I would definitely watch the salt. Served this topped with some freshly grated Parmesan and a side of roasted broccoli. Perfect easy dinner! Thank you so much for the recipe!
